New Records: Giancarlo Stanton reached 25 homers for the 10th time in his MLB career
Gerrit Cole struck out nine batters over six innings before exiting with a calf cramp
Key Match Events: The Yankees scored five runs in the sixth inning to take a significant lead
Gerrit Cole exited the game due to a calf cramp during his warmup pitch
Giancarlo Stanton hit a solo home run in the eighth inning
The game featured a turning point in the sixth inning with a five-run Yankees' rally
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees remained a half-game ahead in the AL East standings after the win
Aaron Boone, the Yankees' manager, was not quoted but the victory was noted as pivotal for their playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees' lineup included high school teammates Anthony Volpe and Jack Leiter, who faced each other in the game
Leiter, a former Texas Rangers draft pick, made his first start in five big league appearances
The Yankees' win marked their fifth consecutive victory over the Rangers
Others: Clarke Schmidt pitched effectively in a rehab start, while Luis Gil was nearing a return to the rotation
Rangers' starters Jacob deGrom and Max Scherzer were scheduled for rehab appearances soon
The game was followed by a matchup of left-handed pitchers the next day
